message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.LG

This paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category as it deals with the implementation of spike-timing-dependent plasticity (STDP) in neuromorphic hardware. It may also belong to the Emerging Technologies (cs.ET) sub-category as it presents a novel method for realizing STDP updates. Additionally, it could be classified under the Architecture (cs.AR) sub-category as it discusses memory-efficient architectures for implementing STDP. The Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper deals with the implementation of synaptic connectivity and plasticity in a scalable neuromorphic system. Finally, the Language and Computation (cs.LG) sub-category is a less likely possibility as the paper does not deal with natural language processing, but it does involve the use of programming languages and hardware description languages for implementing STDP.
